Peter Todd thinks Bitcoin has a problem https://petertodd.org/2022/surprisingly-tail-emission-is-not-inflationary

https://cryptonews.com/exclusives/it-time-begin-talking-seriously-about-bitcoin-tail-emissions.htm
Basically, Todd, Bitcoin Core dev, noted that ‚Äúno proof-of-work (PoW) currency has ever operated solely on transaction fees,‚Äù and that the lack of rewards may make block production unstable in the future.

The inflation rate drops off to essentially zero much faster than that. Sure, the last sat will be mined in 100 years or something. But that last sat is irrelevant. Getting below 0.1% inflation will happen in something like 10 years; we're at about 1.5% already.
